title: Wounds
summary: Disturbing and mysterious things begin to happen to a bartender in New Orleans after he picks up a phone left behind at his bar.
critic_reviews: Wounds is a visceral, disturbing descent into the destruction of a man that hits all of the conventional horror notes with sadistic joy taking viewers on a ride straight to hell.
The lack of local color notwithstanding, the movie more than fulfills its promise to unsettle and to incite shivers — and it doesn’t quit.
Voracious genre consumers should get off on trying to decipher the densely textured film's murky ambiguities.
Anvari has set out to make a mood piece that succeeds in scaring the audience senseless.

Armie Hammer’s Will is definitely hollow at the core. Like a lot of protagonists of horror films, it is his overall weakness as a human being that makes him so vulnerable to the nightmare that unfolds in his life.
It's decent but not deep fare, connecting most with the theme of alcoholism as a different kind of tempting but terrible abyss.
Ultimately, it’s hard to figure out exactly what movie Anvari was trying to make.
Hammer’s character, Will, is an empty vessel, no more than an updated model of the jerkwad boyfriend in every ’80s slasher.

The film’s threadbare story runs parallel to some compelling ideas about masculine insecurity, internalized pain, and the price of genetic privilege, but Anvari’s well-calibrated jump-scare machine is too preoccupied with gross effects, unmotivated jolts, and that strange rash that’s growing in Hammer’s left armpit to engage with any of them.
Once the wounds have healed, Anvari may wish to make a film with the strength and distinctiveness of his debut.

The performers are left with very little to work with and while Hammer does find away of making the most of his haunted alcoholic, Johnson and Zazie Beetz, two wonderful actors, are stranded with hopelessly one-dimensional roles.
There’s nothing more terrifying in this film than the creative talent wasted on such shockingly mediocre material.

reviews.content: I dunno maybe 4 is too high. I gave it because at first was intriguing and like interesting to see what happens next. Then it gets a bit more boring but still hoping that will see how it resolves etc. And then it doesn't even resolve. Ends upI dunno maybe 4 is too high. I gave it because at first was intriguing and like interesting to see what happens next. Then it gets a bit more boring but still hoping that will see how it resolves etc. And then it doesn't even resolve. Ends up being pointless watch.

Yet another "horror" movie with no real storyline, ending or anything scary whatsoever. There seems to be a lot of movies like this nowdays (like hole in the ground etc). At least the actors are good, but the talent is completely wasted inYet another "horror" movie with no real storyline, ending or anything scary whatsoever. There seems to be a lot of movies like this nowdays (like hole in the ground etc). At least the actors are good, but the talent is completely wasted in this movie.

Although boasting an unnerving atmosphere and some disturbing visuals, the average horror aficionado will likely find little to no interest here. There's just not enough to invest in, outside of Armie Hammer's decent lead performance. WhileAlthough boasting an unnerving atmosphere and some disturbing visuals, the average horror aficionado will likely find little to no interest here. There's just not enough to invest in, outside of Armie Hammer's decent lead performance. While the callbacks to H.P. Lovecraft are here, the narrative infrastructure falls apart under the weight of shoddy pacing and an ending that doesn't deliver the payoff needed to make it even worth a simple watch.
Terrible movie with no goddamn point or plot, it is a waste of time dammit.

The premise wasn't bad but the execution was never adequate.It has some interesting moments but in total it's quite irregular.
The rhythm and atmosphere failed to catch my interest beyond the most basic of its plot elements.

The film certainly had exciting moments that kept me watching. However, those moments resulted in nothing. It is for the viewer to guess what the movie is all about (even after the ending). It is for the viewer to guess what the movie is all about (even after the ending). This movie is terrifying and should be getting way more credit. As a horror fanatic I wasn’t expecting much but was clutching my seat the whole time. Really hard to describe this film.
One of the most boring movies I've ever seen, perfect movie if you wanna fall asleep.

Good actors, depressing movie that ends at the wrong point, leaving the audience hanging. This is not a conversation starter, as the film makers aimed for, just a let down. Literally one of the worst movies i've ever seen. No story, no actual ending, just a complete mess. Watch this if you want to waste your time.

This movie is artistic horror, and many will dislike and dismiss. But it’s brilliantly crafted mysterious thrilling horror, you never know why you’re scared because it’s an ominous mystery. The power of suggestion is strong, and the endingThis movie is artistic horror, and many will dislike and dismiss. But it’s brilliantly crafted mysterious thrilling horror, you never know why you’re scared because it’s an ominous mystery. The power of suggestion is strong, and the ending leaves you in a cliffhanger. If you need a horror villain that chases you with cheap jump scares, you’ll hate it. If not this is definitely worth your time.

College kids leave a phone in a bar, the bartender takes it home, gets messages, cockroaches start coming to his house and eat his pal Eric's face.
